page.title: 01NE Corner of Dalby Forest
page.content: An area of roling hills and dales originally called 'Dalby Warren' 75% afforested by forestry commissioned dating fom 1921. The older crops are being felled at rotation age of 50 to 60 years old being replanted with confiers and a sprinkling of trees. There is a forest village at Low Dalby with information and visitor centre plus forest walks and trail. A 10 mile forest drive crosses the area (toll road).There are small holdings and farms in the forest. The high plateau land on either side of the Whitby Road is farmed for sheep and cattle for beef and milk. Many hay fields. Some arable and cereal crops. The aea forms part of the north Yorkshire Moors. Very popular with walkers and pony riders.
